action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway and a pantry here.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a broom closet and a living room here.
You are in a living room now. There are a chair, a couch, a side table, a book and a shelf. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a bedroom and a hallway here.
You take the book. In your inventory you have a book and a plate.
You can't go to a kitchen from here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a broom closet and a living room here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway and a pantry here.

> place book on counter
> place plate on counter
You put the book on the counter.

> take plate from counter
> place plate on counter
The plate is already in your inventory.
You put the plate on the counter.
You can't go to a living room from here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a broom closet and a living room here.
You are in a living room now. There are a chair, a couch, a side table and a shelf. There are passages to a bedroom and a hallway here.
You are in a bedroom now. There are a pillow, a wardrobe, a bed and a table. The pillow is on the bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a living room here.
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow.
You can't go to a kitchen from here.
You can't go to a hallway from here.
You are in a living room now. There are a chair, a couch, a side table and a shelf. There are passages to a bedroom and a hallway here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a broom closet and a living room here.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate, a book and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The book is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway and a pantry here.
You put the pillow on the counter.

> move pillow from counter to table
> move book from counter to table
> move plate from counter to table
I don't know how to interpret this 'move' action.

> take pillow from counter
> place pillow on table
> take book from counter
> place book on table
> take plate from counter
> place plate on table
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow.
You can't see a table here.
You are in a pantry now. There are a freezer and a refrigerator. The freezer is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a plate, a book and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The book is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway and a pantry here.

> take book from counter
> take plate from counter
You take the book. In your inventory you have a book and a pillow.

> drop pillow
> take plate from counter
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.

> place pillow on counter
> take plate from counter
You put the pillow on the counter.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a book and a plate.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a broom closet and a living room here.
You are in a living room now. There are a chair, a couch, a side table and a shelf. There are passages to a bedroom and a hallway here.
You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe, a bed and a table. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a living room here.
You are in a living room now. There are a chair, a couch, a side table and a shelf. There are passages to a bedroom and a hallway here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a broom closet and a living room here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter, a cupboard and a pillow. The cupboard is closed. The pillow is on the counter. There are passages to a hallway and a pantry here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.

> drop book
> take pillow from counter
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.

> place book on counter
> take pillow from counter
You put the book on the counter.
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow and a plate.
You can't go to a living room from here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a broom closet and a living room here.
